[SYNTAX]: Occasionally dense, complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity.
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary (e.g., "arcanic", "quasi-biological", "superorganic") might challenge modern readers.

[STRUCTURE]: The text jumps between personal anecdote, philosophical explanation, and academic critique without clear transitional markers.
[CLARITY]: Assumed knowledge of Spencer's works and 19th-century scientific context may leave some readers disconnected from the narrative's flow.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "It will perhaps be said...")

[LOGIC]: Assumption that readers are familiar with Spencer's full philosophical scope without clear context
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shift from discussing Spencer's later life to analyzing the breadth of his philosophy
